page.title: 05EDUCATION-EYNSFORD
page.content: Our school is called Anthony Roper. We got this name from a man who lived in Elizabethan times. He was Lord of the Manor in Farningham. The stags head on our school badge is from Anthony Ropers coat of arms. When we leave our school his money buys us bibles to take to our next schools. We have a modern primary school. It was built in 1973. It was a single storey building and covers a large area. The children are aged five to eleven. The school is in a lovely environment, it is rural and very green. There are lots of trees and bushes. The first letter of each in a group spells out the message "{MY SON BE WISE}". We often see squirrels and mallard ducks. Last year we had ducks nest quite near our classroom.
